intro: Lloydia yanyuanensis, commonly known as the Yanyuan lloydia, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
